question:
According to Mendeleev's Periodic Table, which elements’ properties matched up remarkably well with eka-silicon?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Mendeleev predicted an element similar to silicon and named it eka-silicon
  • Later, Germanium was discovered with similar properties, confirming Mendeleev’s prediction

question:
Which of the following gases plays an important role in welding titanium, aluminium, stainless steel, and magnesium?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Argon is an inert gas used in welding
  • Prevents oxidation of reactive metals like Ti, Al, Mg, and stainless steel

question:
Which of the following is NOT a halogen gas?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Halogens: Group 17 elements – F, Cl, Br, I, At
  • He (Helium) is a noble gas, not a halogen

question:
Transition elements are the elements that are found in Groups 3-12 of the modern periodic table, that constitute the _____.

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Groups 3 to 12 = d-block elements
  • Known as transition metals, show variable oxidation states and complex formation

question:
To which group do the alkaline earth metals such as radium, barium and strontium belong?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Group 2A elements: Be, Mg, Ca, Sr, Ba, Ra
  • Known as alkaline earth metals

question:
In which musical note did Newland put the metals Co and Ni with halogens?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Newlands arranged elements in musical octaves
  • Co and Ni were incorrectly grouped with halogens under the note 'Do'

question:
Which of the following elements is a metalloid?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Silicon exhibits both metallic and non-metallic properties
  • Classified as a metalloid

question:
‘Au’ is the symbol for which of the following elements?

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Symbol Au comes from Latin word Aurum
  • Au = Gold

question:
In the context of periodicity, a unit called picometre is used to measure the __________.

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• 1 picometre = 10⁻¹² metre
  • Used to measure atomic radii and bond lengths

question:
As per Mendeleev’s prediction, atomic mass of eka-aluminium was:

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Mendeleev predicted eka-aluminium, later identified as Gallium
  • Predicted atomic mass ≈ 68

question:
In Newlands’ Octaves, the properties of lithium and ________ were found to be the same.

SSC CGL 2024 T-1
solution:
• Newlands’ Octave Rule: Every 8th element has similar properties
  • Sodium (8th from lithium) shares similar chemical behavior

question: The behaviour of lithium is similar to that of magnesium. This sort of similarity is commonly referred to as:
solution:
• The behavior of lithium being similar to that of magnesium is commonly referred to as the Diagonal Relationship.
  • This phenomenon occurs between certain pairs of elements that lie diagonally adjacent in the periodic table, leading to similarities in properties.
  • Same Zeff, inert pair effect, and isoelectronic species refer to different chemical concepts.

Additional Information:

  • Lithium (Group 1, Period 2) and magnesium (Group 2, Period 3) show similar chemical behavior despite being in different groups.
  • Diagonal relationship explains similarities in atomic and ionic sizes, electronegativity, and other properties.
  • Other examples include beryllium and aluminum.

question: What are the elements in group zero commonly known as?
solution:
• The elements in Group Zero (Group 18) are commonly known as Inert gases (also called noble gases).
  • These gases are chemically inert due to their complete valence electron shells.
  • They are not reactive, radioactive, or particularly volatile compared to other gases.

Additional Information:

  • Group Zero includes helium, neon, argon, krypton, xenon, and radon.
  • They have very low chemical reactivity and are used in lighting, welding, and as protective atmospheres.
  • Despite being called inert, some heavier noble gases can form compounds under special conditions.

question: What was the symbol Henry Moseley used for denoting atoms number?
solution:
• The symbol used by Henry Moseley to denote atomic number is Z.
  • Atomic number (Z) represents the number of protons in an atom's nucleus.
  • M, U, and A are symbols used for other quantities or elements.

Additional Information:

  • Moseley’s work established the concept of atomic number as fundamental to the organization of the periodic table.
  • Atomic number determines the chemical properties of an element.
  • This discovery helped correct the placement of elements in the periodic table.

question: Which of the following is the correct sequence of alkaline earth metals, according to atomic number?
option_1: Be < Mg < Sr < Ca < Ba
option_2: Be < Mg < Ca < Sr < Ba
option_3: Be < Mg < Ca < Sr < Be
option_4: Mg < Be < Ca < Sr < Ba
solution:
• The correct sequence of alkaline earth metals according to increasing atomic number is:
  • Be < Mg < Ca < Sr < Ba.
  • This sequence follows their position in the periodic table from top to bottom in Group 2.
  • Options (a), (c), and (d) have incorrect ordering.

Additional Information:

  • Beryllium (Be) has atomic number 4.
  • Magnesium (Mg) is 12, Calcium (Ca) is 20, Strontium (Sr) is 38, and Barium (Ba) is 56.
  • These metals share similar chemical properties as alkaline earth metals.

question: Identify an element that has atomic number 7.
solution:
• The element with atomic number 7 is Nitrogen.
  • Nitrogen has 7 protons in its nucleus.
  • Calcium, chlorine, and oxygen have different atomic numbers (20, 17, and 8 respectively).

Additional Information:

  • Nitrogen is a non-metal and makes up about 78% of Earth's atmosphere.
  • It is essential for the formation of amino acids and nucleic acids.
  • Nitrogen gas (N₂) is very stable due to its triple bond.

question: Out of the following metals, choose the odd one out on the basis of their place in the periodic table.
solution:
• The odd one out among the metals based on their position in the periodic table is Magnesium (d).
  • Lithium, sodium, and potassium belong to Group 1 (alkali metals), while magnesium belongs to Group 2 (alkaline earth metals).

Additional Information:

  • Group 1 metals are highly reactive and have one valence electron.
  • Magnesium has two valence electrons and different chemical properties.
  • This difference in group placement makes magnesium distinct from the others.

question: Which of the following options are all transition metals?
option_1: He, Ne, Ar, Au
option_2: F, Cl, Br, I
option_3: Cu, Fe, Ni, Ti
option_4: Na, Mg, Al, Mn
solution:
• The option that contains all transition metals is:
  • (c) Cu, Fe, Ni, Ti.
  • Copper (Cu), Iron (Fe), Nickel (Ni), and Titanium (Ti) are all transition elements found in the d-block of the periodic table.
  • Options (a), (b), and (d) contain noble gases, halogens, or elements that are not all transition metals.

Additional Information:

  • Transition metals typically have partially filled d-orbitals.
  • They exhibit properties like variable oxidation states and form colored compounds.
  • These metals are important in industrial catalysis and metallurgy.

question: Which German chemist was the first to show a graphical representation of the periodicity of an atomic volume plotted against atomic weight?
solution:
• The German chemist who was the first to show a graphical representation of the periodicity of atomic volume plotted against atomic weight is Lothar Meyer.
  • Lothar Meyer independently developed a periodic classification similar to Mendeleev’s and plotted atomic volumes to demonstrate periodic trends.
  • William Ramsay, John Newlands, and Glenn T Seaborg made other important contributions to chemistry but not this specific graphical representation.

Additional Information:

  • Lothar Meyer’s work helped in understanding the periodic nature of elements before Mendeleev’s periodic table was widely accepted.
  • His graphs showed the periodic variation of atomic volume clearly with atomic weight.
  • This work supported the idea of periodicity in elemental properties.

question:
Identify whether the given statements about p-block elements are correct or incorrect.

Statement A: In p-block elements, the last electron enters the outermost p orbital.

Statement B: The non-metals and metalloids exist only in the p-block of the periodic table.
option_1: Both Statements A and B are correct
option_2: Only Statement A is correct
option_3: Only Statement B is correct
option_4: Both Statements A and B are incorrect
solution:
• Statement A is correct: In p-block elements, the last electron indeed enters the outermost p orbital.
  • Statement B is also correct: Non-metals and metalloids are primarily found in the p-block of the periodic table.

Therefore, the correct answer is:

(a) Both Statements A and B are correct.

Additional Information:

  • The p-block elements include groups 13 to 18 in the periodic table.
  • This block contains metals, metalloids, and non-metals.
  • The p orbital can hold up to 6 electrons, influencing the chemical properties of these elements.

question: Which of the following elements is a member of the actinide series?
solution:
• The element that is a member of the actinide series is Thorium (b).
  • Thorium is a radioactive actinide element with atomic number 90.
  • Lutetium and lanthanum belong to the lanthanide series, and magnesium is an alkaline earth metal.

Additional Information:

  • Actinides are located in the f-block of the periodic table and are mostly radioactive.
  • Thorium has applications in nuclear reactors and other nuclear technologies.
  • Lanthanides and actinides together are called inner transition metals.

question: Which element of the boron family has a high boiling point, making it ideal for recording temperatures that would vaporise a thermometer?
solution:
• The element of the boron family with a high boiling point, making it ideal for recording temperatures that would vaporize a thermometer, is Gallium (d).
  • Gallium has a melting point near room temperature but a very high boiling point, making it useful in high-temperature thermometers.
  • Indium, thallium, and aluminum have different boiling points and are less suitable for this purpose.

Additional Information:

  • Gallium melts at about 29.7°C and boils at around 2204°C.
  • Its unique properties allow it to remain liquid over a wide temperature range.
  • Gallium is used in thermometers as a non-toxic alternative to mercury.

question: Which chemical element of Group 18 of the periodic table is produced by the natural radioactive decay of uranium in soils and rocks?
solution:
• The chemical element of Group 18 produced by the natural radioactive decay of uranium in soils and rocks is Radon (b).
  • Radon is a radioactive noble gas that forms as uranium and thorium decay naturally in the Earth’s crust.
  • Neon, oganesson, and krypton are noble gases but are not produced by this process.

Additional Information:

  • Radon is colorless, odorless, and tasteless but radioactive and hazardous to health.
  • It can accumulate in buildings and contribute to indoor air pollution.
  • Radon exposure is linked to lung cancer risk.

question: Which radioactive element with atomic number 43 in the modern periodic table is unstable, and the half-lives of all its isotopes are relatively short, from 4.2 million years to 5.0 s?
solution:
• The radioactive element with atomic number 43, unstable with isotopes having half-lives ranging from 4.2 million years to 5.0 seconds, is Technetium (c).
  • Technetium is the lightest element with no stable isotopes.
  • Promethium, nobelium, and neptunium have different atomic numbers and properties.

Additional Information:

  • Technetium is used in medical diagnostic procedures as a radioactive tracer.
  • It was the first artificially produced element.
  • Its name derives from the Greek word "technetos," meaning artificial.

question: Which soft metal in group 1 of the periodic table tarnishes within a few seconds of exposure to air?
solution:
• The soft metal in Group 1 of the periodic table that tarnishes within a few seconds of exposure to air is Sodium (b).
  • Sodium reacts rapidly with oxygen and moisture in the air, forming a dull oxide layer.
  • Barium, strontium, and francium also react with air but not as rapidly as sodium.

Additional Information:

  • Sodium is a highly reactive alkali metal stored under oil to prevent reaction with air or moisture.
  • It has important uses in industry and chemical synthesis.
  • The tarnishing is due to formation of sodium oxide or sodium hydroxide on its surface.

question: In which year did John Alexander Newlands propound a new concept of the ‘Law of Octaves’ proposing the periodicity of chemical elements arranged in order of atomic weight?
solution:
• John Alexander Newlands propounded the new concept of the ‘Law of Octaves’ proposing the periodicity of chemical elements arranged in order of atomic weight in the year 1865 (b).
  • This was an early attempt to classify elements based on their properties repeating every eighth element.
  • Other years listed are incorrect for this specific discovery.

Additional Information:

  • Newlands’ Law of Octaves was one of the precursors to the modern periodic table.
  • It was initially met with skepticism but laid important groundwork.
  • Later, Mendeleev expanded and refined the periodic classification.

question: Which s-block element is a silvery-white metal that is used in an alloy with copper or nickel to make gyroscopes, springs, electrical contacts, spot-welding electrodes, and non-sparking equipment?
solution:
• The s-block element that is a silvery-white metal used in alloys with copper or nickel for making gyroscopes, springs, electrical contacts, spot-welding electrodes, and non-sparking equipment is Beryllium (a).
  • Beryllium is lightweight, strong, and has excellent thermal stability.
  • Rubidium, francium, and caesium are alkali metals with different properties and uses.

Additional Information:

  • Beryllium-copper alloys are known for high strength and non-magnetic properties.
  • It is used in aerospace and precision instruments.
  • Handling beryllium requires care due to its toxicity in dust form.

question: Which d-block element in the periodic table is represented by the Greek symbol ‘alpha’ and the metallic ‘rays’?
solution:
• The d-block element represented by the Greek symbol ‘alpha’ and associated with the metallic ‘rays’ is Actinium (b).
  • Actinium is a radioactive element and the first element in the actinide series.
  • Lanthanum, rhenium, and tungsten are different elements with different symbols and properties.

Additional Information:

  • Actinium was discovered due to its strong radioactivity.
  • It emits alpha particles, hence the association with the Greek letter alpha.
  • Actinium has applications in radiation therapy and scientific research.

question: The number of elements known at the time of Russian chemist Dmitri Ivanovich Mendeleev was:
solution:
• The number of elements known at the time of Russian chemist Dmitri Ivanovich Mendeleev was 63 (c).
  • Mendeleev developed his periodic table based on these known elements and predicted properties of undiscovered elements.
  • Other options (57, 53, 67) are not accurate for that time.

Additional Information:

  • Mendeleev’s periodic table was published in 1869.
  • His work laid the foundation for the modern periodic table.
  • He left gaps for elements yet to be discovered and predicted their properties.

question: Which is the soft, malleable and silvery-yellow metal with atomic number 59 in the lanthanide series?
solution:
• The soft, malleable, and silvery-yellow metal with atomic number 59 in the lanthanide series is Praseodymium (b).
  • Praseodymium is known for its bright yellowish color and is used in alloys and magnets.
  • Neodymium, promethium, and gadolinium have different properties and atomic numbers.

Additional Information:

  • Praseodymium is used in manufacturing strong permanent magnets and in lighting.
  • It is relatively reactive and must be handled carefully.
  • It belongs to the lanthanide series, which consists of elements with similar chemical properties.

question: In which group of the Periodic Table will you put the elements with electronic configuration [He]2S22p6?
solution:
• The elements with the electronic configuration [He] 2s² 2p⁶ belong to Group 18 (c) of the periodic table.
  • This configuration corresponds to a complete p-orbital, characteristic of noble gases like neon.
  • Groups 6, 8, and 10 contain transition or other elements with different configurations.

Additional Information:

  • Group 18 elements are known as noble or inert gases.
  • They have full valence shells, making them chemically very stable.
  • Examples include helium, neon, argon, krypton, xenon, and radon.

question: A diagonal relationship is found between which pair of the following elements?
solution:
• The diagonal relationship is found between the pair of elements Li (Lithium) and Mg (Magnesium) (a).
  • These elements show similarities in properties despite belonging to different groups because of their diagonal positions in the periodic table.
  • Other pairs do not exhibit this well-known diagonal relationship.

Additional Information:

  • Lithium and magnesium have comparable ionic sizes and chemical behaviors.
  • This relationship occurs between elements that are diagonally adjacent in the s and p blocks.
  • It explains why some elements in different groups show similar chemical properties.

question: What is the name of the 87th element on the periodic table that has no known biological role because it has a half-life of only 22 minutes?
solution:
• The 87th element on the periodic table, which has no known biological role and a half-life of only about 22 minutes, is Francium (d).
  • Francium is a highly radioactive alkali metal and is very rare in nature.
  • Meitnerium, Dubnium, and Seaborgium are synthetic elements with higher atomic numbers and different properties.

Additional Information:

  • Francium is the heaviest alkali metal.
  • Its extreme radioactivity and short half-life make it difficult to study.
  • It was discovered in 1939 by Marguerite Perey.

question: What is the atomic number of Bohrium which is named after physicist Niels Bohr, one of the founders of quantum theory?
solution:
• The atomic number of Bohrium, named after physicist Niels Bohr, is 107 (b).
  • Bohrium is a synthetic element in the transactinide series.
  • Other options correspond to different elements with different atomic numbers.

Additional Information:

  • Bohrium is a highly radioactive element with no stable isotopes.
  • It was first synthesized in 1981.
  • Named to honor Niels Bohr for his contributions to quantum mechanics.

question: Which element of group 13 has the atomic number 113 and its electronic configuration is [Rn] 5f146d107s27p1?
solution:
• The element of Group 13 with atomic number 113 and electronic configuration [Rn] 5f¹⁴ 6d¹⁰ 7s² 7p¹ is Nihonium (c).
  • Nihonium is a synthetic, highly radioactive element.
  • Gallium, indium, and thallium have lower atomic numbers and different configurations.

Additional Information:

  • Nihonium was officially named in 2016.
  • It is a superheavy element with very limited practical applications due to its radioactivity and short half-life.
  • It was discovered by a joint team of Russian and Japanese scientists.
